definition: Liu Yong (987-1053), Song poet
old variant of 柳[liu3]
old variant of 柳[liu3]
surname Liu
willow
forever/always/perpetual

sentences.english: Su Shi's criticism against Liu Yong was not aimed at his "gracefulness", but his conformity to vulgarity instead.
sentences.chinese: 苏轼批评柳永并非针对“婉约”，而是针对“从俗”。

sentences.english: All these demonstrate Liu's contribution to the development of lyric poetry and promotion of metrical patterns.
sentences.chinese: 这体现了柳永对发展词乐和推进词律的贡献。

sentences.english: Yiu Yong has a deep and complicated influence on the history or China's Ci.
sentences.chinese: 柳永在中国词史上的影响深远而复杂。

sentences.english: Liu Yong is a critical person in the history of Song Ci.
sentences.chinese: 柳永是宋词发展史上一位关键性的人物。

sentences.english: Liu Yong was a very popular Ci writer who was full of autumn moods.
sentences.chinese: 柳永是一位有着深厚的悲秋情结的词人。

definition: Li Qingzhao (1084-c. 1151), southern Song female poet

Su Shi (1037-1101), also known as Su Dongpo 蘇東坡|苏东坡[Su1 Dong1 po1] northern Song Dynasty writer and calligrapher/one of the Three Su father and sons 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and one of the Eight Giants of Tang and Song Prose 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 Ba1 Da4 jia1]
Ouyang Xiu (1007-1072), Northern Song dynasty prose writer and historian
Li Yu (c. 937-978), given name of the final ruler of Tang of the Five Southern dynasties Li Houzhu 李後主|李后主, a renowned poet
writer of 詞|词[ci2] (a kind of Classical Chinese poem)/person of literary talent
Lu You (1125-1210), widely regarded as the greatest of the Southern Song poets
Li Shangyin (c. 813-858), Tang poet
Li Houzhu (c. 937-978), the final Southern Tang ruler (ruled 961-975) and a renowned poet/given name Li Yu 李煜
Du Mu (803-852) Tang dynasty poet
Song Qi (998-1061), Song dynasty poet and writer, coauthor of History of the Later Tang Dynasty 新唐書|新唐书
Fan Zhongyan (989-1052), minister of Northern Song who led the failed reform of 1043, author of On Yueyang Tower 岳陽樓記|岳阳楼记
Su Dongpo, another name for Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼 (1037-1101), northern Song writer and calligrapher
Huang Tingjian (1045-1105), Song poet and calligrapher
Lin Bu (967-1028), Northern Song poet
Wang Anshi (1021-1086), Song dynasty politician and writer, one of the Eight Giants 唐宋八大家
Su Zhe (1039-1112), Northern Song writer and calligrapher, one of the 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and also one of the 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 ba1 da4 jia1]
